review_title: Great People Who Want to Make a Difference
job_title: Supervisor in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: Psychologist in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I like the work but am so much happier now that I don’t work at PR anymore.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Good paid time off, decent insurance benefits
cons:
Pine Rest will not pay their techs a wage worth staying for. Starting wage is $16 an hour as of February 2022. The McDonalds down the road from the Pine Rest campus starts at up to $16. Pine Rest is only willing to pay the same amount of money you could earn flipping burgers to take responsibility for the safety of their patients and to put their lives in your hands. You do not earn raises based on your reviews done by your supervisors and by those who see your hard work, you have to spend several hours unpaid creating a portfolio to submit to a committee of people with whom you rarely, if not never, interact in order to get raise. These portfolios have very little to do with your experience and ability to do your job. 
The staff turnover rate is very quick with most staff not even lasting a year. Experience is under appreciated and there are not many opportunities for advancement. There are often times that, due to staffing shortages, you are mandated to stay on an extra shift and if you refuse to stay you can be written up. You are also required to work 2 extra short shifts every 6 weeks and every other holiday. Not a very flexible job for single parents, people with other jobs, or anyone that values their own time.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Wonderful people with great heart and tenacity for the work they do.
cons: Underpaid- understaffed - overworked- typical plight of hospitals

review_title: Superiors need to spend more time on the floor and less time in their offices/meetings
job_title: Primary Caregiver in Grandville, MI
pros: Working with the patients can be very rewarding.
cons: Supervisors care more about keeping their superiors happy than staff and patient safety.

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Pine Rest, MA
pros: Benefits, Peers, Schedule, Supervision, Flexibility
cons: Salary for the work you are providing

job_title: Manager in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Great place for treatment for behavioral health

job_title: Medical Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great people. Love the teamwork.

job_title: Psych Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I loved my job! Nothing better than watching suffering people get healthy again.

review_title: Out of touch management,  extremely low pay.  Tough to get raises
job_title: Psych Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You can actually help people. Good people on the Frontline.
cons:
Out of touch management, embarrassingly low pay, mandated to stay past your shift, you have to do a bunch of extra work just to get a very small raise.
 The upper management is so out of touch. It's a bunch of old guys that never leave their office or just work from home. The only time you see them us when the send out stupid videos telling everyone how great everything is. They say they are going to fix things but don't.
 You can make more starting at a fast food restaurant. They havent paid their front line workers correctly in months. Just keep hearing that it will get fixed eventually. The "raises" you can apply for are super small and not worth the extra time you have to take to get them. You get mandated to stay and work a full shift after your scheduled shift often and if you say you can't you get written up which means you can't get a "raise" for a year. 
 They don't care about anything but making money so they can give management and Dr big raises.
 Should be better once the RN's and Psych Techs Unionize.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You get to serve the residents and get to play an instrumental role in their lives.
cons: Low pay and very stressful at times. I did not appreciate how I was treated by my supervisor as well. On multiple occasions I would go to speak and get cut off. I’m just not a fan of disrespect nor will I ever be.

job_title: Assessment and Referral Clinician in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: Administrative Support Specialist in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: Administrative Intake Support Staff in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: PMHNP in Grand Rapids, MI

review_title: Does not compensate well- difficult to get raises - staffing is a nightmare
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Caring for a diverse population with a broad variety of psychiatric diagnoses. Coworkers are great and in the inpatient hospital there is good team work. There is plenty of overtime.
cons: Compensation is poor, raises aren't based on performance and they make you jump through a lot of hoops just to get one. They have open staffing so even if you are a core nurse on a specific unit you will often be moved to other units and you won't know you've been moved until you arrive to work. Plan on getting mandated to work beyond your scheduled shift frequently. No sick time- they make you use your PTO for holiday pay, sick days, and even clocking out early from a shift will dock your PTO.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: Intake Support Specialist in Grand Rapids, MI

review_title: Best organization  I’ve ever worked for
job_title: Administrative Staff in Cutlerville, MI
pros:
Company genuinely cares about its employees and employee morale. Pine Rest invests so much in their employee morale, more than any other company I’ve EVER worked for. 
Company makes you feel valued which makes you want to work 10x harder for them. 
Decent benefits.
Amazingly supportive co workers and supervisors.
You get the chance to genuinely help people who are going through some of the worst moments of their lives and be there for them through it all. 
Couldn’t say enough great things about Pine Rest.
cons:
Lack of communication between departments 
Honestly that is the only con I’ve encountered while working here.

review_title: Originally Pine Rest was a mental health farm

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Cutlerville, MI

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Flexible scheduling if you're in the right department.
cons: Took a long time after being hired to get any hours and did not get the shift or position I was promised during the interview process.

review_title: Mixed Bag -- unfair wage, high turnover, good benefits, good life experience. Some units better than others
job_title: Patient Care Provider in Cutlerville, MI
pros: You'll develop experience to deal with conflict applicable to any other venue in life. You'll develop a sense of whether the mental health field suits your disposition. "Full-time" entails only four days of work per week, and we receive a generous (yet necessary) amount of annual PTO, 156 hours.
cons:
No one expects patient care providers to make a sustainable living. Most people leave in 6-8 months, as reported by management. I like my unit, but I see other units as negligent and unprofessional - choose where you work wisely.

Prepare for a life of humility, both at work - dealing with aggressive, agitated patients - and at home - considering you make less than a living wage ($10/hr, $16,800/yr). Oh, and take a look at the company's 990 - their public tax information. Net revenue in 2014 is $100 million, and the highest paid employee gets $510k.

review_title: Love the work and people, just didn’t work enough
job_title: Occupational Therapist in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: People are great, Activities, Mission
cons: Low hours, Variability, Hard to schedule

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros:
-Potential for raises
-Paid time off
-Benefits
cons:
-Rude staff
-No one takes anything seriously

review_title: Good mission, staffing is a nightmare, management a bit  unorganized.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Cutlerville, MI
pros: Good psych facility, patient care was top notch, psych techs were amazing and well trained. As an RN, I always appreciated the level of teamwork on my unit, patient was safety always number one priority. HR staff was phenomenal, educators also highly trained and seemed to genuinely  enjoy passing their knowledge on to the staff.
cons:
Staffing was one of the strangest things I have come across, instead of using staffing companies, or beefing up PRN pool, they would wait until last hour of shift to tell nurse and tech staff they had to stay and work another shift. For that reason, morale among staff was always poor.  Most had families, kids in daycare, etc, so this was a nightmare for them.  

Unorganized, while out on medical leave I got a form letter from new manager of my unit asking for my keys (and telling me I had been separated from the company) because I "hadn't picked up shifts in a while." That was a big disappointment in their level of professionalism in my opinion. However, that may have just been one lazy manager, as the ones I actually worked with were top notch.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Good PTO and benefit package
cons: Pay is not market average

job_title: Psych Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You will grow to have an attachment to the people you work with
cons: The company will use you and abuse you, getting hurt at work is not a question of if but a question of when

job_title: Psych Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Management really cares and everyone has your back
cons: Staffing model could use some work

review_title: Wonderful place to serve an underserved population.
job_title: in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Strong emphasis on customer service and client care. Caring co-workers who share a passion for mental health. Overall team work and team approach to challenging issues. Improving opportunities for input and connectivity. Great PTO package, 403b plan. Generally speaking, the staff at Pine Rest, from the unit level care providers up through management all share a desire to serve in mental health. There is a definite commitment to the mission of the organization.
cons: Pay is not good, but it's a non-profit business so that's to be expected. Benefits are actually ok, not great, but decent and fairly reasonably priced in comparison to other organizations. Frequent communication breakdowns between upper management and unit staff, although that's been a focus for improvement with measured results. Occasional conflict between disciplines, i.e. Dr. vs RN or RN vs Care Provider, etc... Opportunities for advancement are minimal, particularly if you are not in the nursing profession. There can be a definite sense of favoritism, despite concerted efforts to avoid or denials of its existence. But Drs and RNs are treated much better than Care Providers or Support Staff and staff on the "good side" of management are given a lot of leniency where as staff of the "bad side" of management are cut no slack, regardless of how hard they work.

job_title: Support Staff in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great coworkers and the company is willing to care for your needs.
cons: Stressful job at some points.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Lots of great experience here.
cons: Management could improve, although it was in the middle of a pandemic.

review_title: Good place to make a difference in people's lives
job_title: Chaplain in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great staff, well organized, nice campus
cons: It can be difficult to work with extremely ill patients

job_title: RN in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great team environment. Most Pine Rest RNs are compassionate and actually care about the work they do. The RN group is younger which is nice because most other places I've worked for have had an aging RN population. Really nice campus and easy location for commuting. Lots of opportunity to do different things if you get burned out with hospital they have many other areas to consider. Great benefits, especially if you're single. Benefits still good if you have a family (I am told). PTO is really good and is given to everyone at beginning of the year. They are growing and building a new inpatient unit, hospital will be well over 200 beds when new unit opens. They just told RNs our pay scale is changing and it's for the better. Wages seem close to what I made elsewhere, but may be better now? Patient load is manageable I usually have about 5-7 myself. Pine Rest seems to care about employees and patients a lot. They are really kind. I think this is a great place to be.
cons: Psych nursing is not easy as I have found out. It's been a great learning experience though not easy. The pay wasn't great when I started but it's changing which is great. Gets a bad rep for being a Psych hospital, but I haven't found it to be true.

job_title: Pyschiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: the patients are the best part
cons: Upper management preaches one thing and fails to deliver. no emphasis on patient safety. some therapists seem unqualified at times. Executives' priorities arent on the patients instead on $$

review_title: I would never work there again
job_title: Help Desk Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: absolutely none at all honestly
cons: They are very unprofessional, and they are enablers and drug pushers not interested in helping patients at all

review_title: Addictions Services - Retreat Center - Sub Acute Detox
job_title: Nurse Manager in Grand Rapids, MI
pros:
As a Registered Nurse working in the addictions services division of Pine Rest, specifically the Retreat Center and Sub Acute Detox - I highly recommend working for this program here. 
It is a very team oriented, highly skilled, professional area to work in.  The staff are very passionate about working in the addictions field and truly care for the patients that we serve every day.  We help save lives!  Working here has shown me what it truly means to feel respected as a Registered Nurse and I can honestly say I've never worked in a setting where Case Managers, Doctors and Nurses all work together so well.  We're a great team.  You won't find a better team environment anywhere else! 

We are growing and expanding everyday with innovative new ideas for serving the addictions community and if I had family members that needed treatment - this is the ONLY place I would refer them. 

They have a great incentive program for compensation increase based on performance. 

Passion, Professionalism, Positivity and Teamwork. 100%
cons: PTO time does not roll over.  Health Insurance company is good, but could be better.

job_title: Psych Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You get to follow the dream of helping kids who "just need a little love and attention" the job can be very easy some shifts, and occasionally the kids can be sweet
cons: Getting assaulted is standard, anything from punched in the face to broken bones.  Those kids who "just needed a little extra love" often should be in jail not pine rest. For the most part the kids are only in pine rest because they are so bad no one else wants them and the job itself kills all dreams of actually helping a majority of the kids.  Oh and the easy shifts are few and far between, more often it feels like you're doing the job of 2-3 people and should be getting hazard but aren't.

review_title: Know which Unit is right for you.
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great company, great co-workers. The different units have different nuances. If you're young and full of compassion and would appreciate a role that allows you to be hands on with patients in need, I recommend Child and Adolescent Unit. If youre looking for a strictly by the books in-and-out position, I recommend East. If you like a challenge and are thick skinned, I recommend West. If you want even more of a challenge, Older Adult.
cons: Mental health isn't well funded and thats reflected in salary regardless of unit. Some of the units are over-worked; take Older Adult for example - not enough staff on the floor to cover everything and all patient needs. People are worn out and as a result are task-oriented / do just enough to get by, which lowers morale.

review_title: TIRESOME, Often work longer just to keep up with the pace.
job_title: Administrative Secretary in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The regulars (patients) are great.  Most of them like seeing your familiar face and it helps the high stress involvement.  The PTO is decent, however you get alloted hours towards EVERYTHING- illness, vacation, holidays..etc., There are some great people that work for Pine Rest so when you actually take a breath and converse with coworkers it can be fun.
cons: High Stressful environment.  You harden from patients consistantly flying off the handle.  Getting copays @ appts can be a battle.  Pay is not worth the hard work involved.  Outpatient clinics are rude to one another and gossip about each other, teamwork between clinics is AWEFUL.  Often work is unbalanced, some people have to pick up slack for others.  No advancement Opport.

job_title: Patient Care Provider in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Friendly staff and welcoming work environment. Typically 8-hour workdays and flexible scheduling for part-time or per-diem work. Good work for college students who are wanting some patient care experience.
cons: The work is often stressful and you do not get payed that well for what you do. However, the managers and nurses are typically helpful in getting to know the units and they often know how to best treat the patients. The Care Provider job is not great for a full-time job and the stress that goes along with it can cause some to easily burn-out.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Good PTO and benefits, compensation is well structured, fulfilling to help people and work with patients.
cons: You WILL get your hair pulled, hit, punched, kicked, slapped, spit on, etc. Management doesn't do anything to prevent it. Protocol is almost NEVER followed as it needs to be. I was TERRIBLY assaulted by a resident resulting in a concussion, chest contusion, and back injuries. Not only did management NOT call the police or an ambulance, I was told to sit outside (with a concussion), and wait for my boyfriend to come and bring me to med-1. Beyond that, HR is completely useless. You have to fight tooth and nail for any kind of help. Asked about workers compensation for 3 weeks before they finally gave it to me. I was bullied into resigning from my position. STEER CLEAR OF THIS POSITION.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I've worked in a clinic setting at PR in a resource position.  My manager cares about us and our unit works well together. She communicates/educates us and I feel she is the reason the clinic runs so smooth. We have competent, caring coworkers and physicians.  We are told at Pinerest we are important to the organization by my manager.  Even our CEO expresses that at our annual holiday party.  PR really does what their mission statement says! When management makes you feel important, you will work harder.
cons: None.  PR is the number one place in healthcare to work in GR! Not all organizations make you feel valued the way PR does.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Everyone gets along really well for the most part and do a great job of working together as a group for the well being of patients.  Management cares about their employees and are very approachable  for any questions, concerns, or ideas you may have. Helping to make a difference in people's lives makes it worth it and thats a mindset everyone at Pine Rest shares.
cons: Compensation is not enough to live off unless you have help from parents or a significant other. If you have any debt or multiple monthly payments you will not be able to afford them without working a lot of overtime hours.

review_title: The most toxic work environment I have encountered in entire nursing career with absolutely no back up from management .
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Christian based , Rewarding to assist clients in finding a way to cope with life without substance abuse.
cons: Building literally falling down. Promises of improvement for entire 4 + years That I worked there. Administration moves their problem manager from clinic to clinic without solving issues with no regard for whether person has experience in this particular field. Run as a business not person centered care.Very toxic environment among employees management ignores this.

job_title: Patient Care Provider in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Managers and co-workers truly care about you and will do anything to help you personally and professionally; 23 days Paid Time Off as soon as you start; extremely flexible scheduling staff to help you however you need schedule-wise; working with patients is rewarding; incentive shifts are frequently available for extra pay if you want to pick them up
cons: low pay; healthcare benefits mediocre; not much room for advancement; mandate shifts are awful; if you work second shift it totally takes over your personal life; certain patients can make you depressed if you're susceptible to others' emotions. Just make sure to separate yourself from the patients emotionally and you'll be okay.

job_title: Residents Support Coordinator in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I felt Pine Rest cared about their employees.  I attended employees christmas party, and some other events on campus.  I received a bonus check which was a very nice surprise.  They provided many classes where a Social Worker could get CEU's at no cost, and because I needed my SW License for my position it was paid by PR. Very nice benefits.
cons: The position I helt was in the community at a public housing complex. It was a very isolating job with many complex problems. The supervisor was not supportive and had done the job for years so he felt it should be done his way or hit the highway.

review_title: Great mental health organization to work for!
job_title: Resident Care Provider in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: At Pine Rest, I am a resident care provider at the adult secure unit.  The pay is decent and there are always hours to pick up if you are not full time.  The benefits are also pretty good compared to most other part time jobs.
cons: The position can be very stressful, depending on where you are.  Some people love it and some hate it.  Make sure you ask good questions at your interview so that there are not any surprises.

job_title: Care Provider in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I worked here for just under a year and loved working with the patients day in and out. Had a great experience helping serve in this environment even though it can be very tiring and progress can be hard to see.
cons: Much of the other care providers are great but communication can be lacking and inconsistent.For a therapeutic care center, I feel like the therapeutic side of the living situation is lacking a bit.

review_title: Great for experience, pay is very low
job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The opportunity to work with populations not typically offered. Lots of availability to pick up shifts for overtime
cons: Management is not helpful. More often than not, management and supervisors are burdened with too many responsibilities and cannot afford any time to lead correctly. This then trickles down to all of their staff who are already exhausted and overworked. Be prepared to be expected to cover for employees or supervisors mistakes and incidents. No acknowledgement for hard work.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Cutlerville, MI
pros: Patient care always comes first. No matter cost. Patients are treated equally and without judgement. Pay is great for my position.
cons: As with any psych facility, one can become worn out when dealing with patients. Also, staffing can be an issue. Mandated shifts aren't that uncommon, and it really is hard going to work and not knowing if you can go home when your shift is done.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros:
get to help with people with disabilities
on the job training
learning more about psychiatric disorders
work with psychiatric disorders
cons: Management is horrible. They don't take you into account and will not help you if needed. Some managers are alright though depends on the unit.

job_title: Intern in Holland, MI
pros:
-Great staff
-Purpose Driven
-Decent Pay

I think this company has the right intentions, although I don't believe in a heavy drug dependent treatment. However, some of the patients are so violent there are few alternatives. I have had a good experience and it is a great company overall.
cons: I did not have a lot of problems with this job, other than the double shifts. It is great if you are working part-time and need extra hours, but inconvenient. The benefits are sub-par.

job_title: Therapist in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I love working at the Pine Rest addiction medicine clinic.  We are a close group that works really well together.  Management listens to us and I feel appreciated in my job.    Work hours can be flexible.  Overall, Pine Rest values it's employees and works to retain good employees.
cons: The only con I have doesn't have to do with the organization, it has to do with some of the buildings that could use work.

job_title: Resident Care Provider in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Helping others, good benefits if you're a full time employee. Pine rest is a rewarding place of work, and there are a lot of locations to work at throughout west Michigan. Also, there is so much room for growth and mobility.
cons: Long hours, a lot of paper work most days. It's hard not to take your work with you at the end of the day.

job_title: Psych Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You learn a lot about coping skills, the other staff work as a team to help you when patients are having an outburst
cons: The pay is low for the type of work we do, it does not look like the doctors care about the patients but are eager to prescribe medication, and many patients are readmits

job_title: Intake Coordinator in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: People are kind, everyone tries hard to be of service to patients and the community. Lots of heart
cons: Disorganized management, they take an unexplainably long time to fix problems and make decisions. Zero communication between departments.

review_title: Seeks out people with Codependent issues
job_title: Registered Nurse in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Opens your eyes to how patient with Mental illness are treated. Had insurance. No problem getting extra hours.
cons: Low Pay, unorganized, unsafe, alot of messed up things happen there,  unqualifed staff running groups full of people who have serious mental illness, the whole place is one crisis away from disaster. Thats what it is...crisis management instead of structure and direction. It's so sad!

job_title: Clinical Care Coordinator in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Can make a difference in people's lives; every day is interesting; good experience for the resume; good benefits.
cons: Can be very stressful at times; easy to burn out from working too hard/too much because there's never enough help; being on-call is very stressful; poor compensation; difficult to move up.

job_title: Care Provider in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Plenty of experience in multiple populations, such as children, teens, adults and geriatrics. Great competitive pay!  Multiple shift times to choose from.
cons: Set shift times, so not very flexible with hours. Hard work, mental health is very draining (but worth it!)

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Lots of available hours, good experience working with vulnerable populations, supportive work culture, can have a flexible work schedule if needed.
cons: High burnout rate due to challenging population, high staff turnover at some units, lower pay compared to same position elsewhere for front line staff.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The people I work with are amazing I have not had a bad encounters with any staff in my three years of working here. They really do care about their staff.
cons: Clients can be difficult to work with.

job_title: Lab Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Patients were wonderful, 1st shift hours— out by 12pm or 1pm, benefits
cons: Poor managment, per diem jobs only, understaffed
